instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.ALL_SYS: What is ALL_SYS? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD When you see ALL_SYS, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot no chime
threads.message:
voltages present

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>

the only thing i can see is <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> has 3.3v instead of 3v? is this normal or did apple lie to us?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot no chime
threads.message:
Voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?
Green light?
Water damage?
Any voltage on L7260? even a pulse?
Voltage on <RESISTOR>R1300</RESISTOR> to <RESISTOR>R1303</RESISTOR> boths pins?
<SIGNAL>SYSCLK_CLK32K_RTC</SIGNAL> present?
Any history?

PPVRTC is ok...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot no chime
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 33929"]Voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?
Green light?
Water damage?
Any voltage on L7260? even a pulse?
Voltage on <RESISTOR>R1300</RESISTOR> to <RESISTOR>R1303</RESISTOR> boths pins?
<SIGNAL>SYSCLK_CLK32K_RTC</SIGNAL> present?
Any history?

PPVRTC is ok...[/QUOTE]

12.6v on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
green light is present.
there is some sign of water damage- board seems to be washed previous.
5v on L7260
1.05v on <RESISTOR>R1300</RESISTOR> & <RESISTOR>R1302</RESISTOR>

no known history,

ppvrtc on 3.3v

im suspecting the <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot no chime
threads.message: Sorry my mistake, i meant <RESISTOR>R1800</RESISTOR> to <RESISTOR>R1803</RESISTOR>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no boot no chime
threads.message: If there is 5V on L7260 it is powering on even 1.05V is present on <RESISTOR>R1300</RESISTOR>. Check if <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS</SIGNAL> is present, if not you'll have to find the missing power rail.
